1.text: And Elihu went on to say:

2.text: “Do you think this is just? You say, ‘I am more righteous than God.’

3.text: For you ask, ‘What does it profit me, and what benefit do I gain apart from sin?’

4.text: I will reply to you and to your friends as well.

5.text: Look to the heavens and see; gaze at the clouds high above you.

6.text: If you sin, what do you accomplish against Him? If you multiply your transgressions, what do you do to Him?

7.text: If you are righteous, what do you give Him, or what does He receive from your hand?

8.text: Your wickedness affects only a man like yourself, and your righteousness only a son of man.

9.text: Men cry out under great oppression; they plead for relief from the arm of the mighty.

10.text: But no one asks, ‘Where is God my Maker, who gives us songs in the night,

11.text: who teaches us more than the beasts of the earth and makes us wiser than the birds of the air?’

12.text: There they cry out, but He does not answer, because of the pride of evil men.

13.text: Surely God does not listen to empty pleas, and the Almighty does not take note of it.

14.text: How much less, then, when you say that you do not see Him, that your case is before Him and you must wait for Him,

15.text: and further, that in His anger He has not punished or taken much notice of folly!

16.text: So Job opens his mouth in vain and multiplies words without knowledge.”
